Articles.Content:
So I've been away for awhile. Recently got the new DLC and started playing again after about a year off... It seems like all my rovers work fine if I load them out of the hangar, but when I export them as a subassembly and put them in a craft they develop this crazy bouncing. It isn't just this rover. I have tried 5 or 6 and the rover in this video I created brand new just to see if it was something with my old rovers. It seems weird they work fine if I just load them by themselves on the runway, but they go crazy if I bring them in as subassemblies.

 

Edit: Just made a whole new rover with the same results. It works deploying from a similar setup from the hangar, but not imported as a sub-assembly. Driving me mad! The bounce from repairing the tires, breaks more tires!

 

Edited April 10, 2018 by banderling
Still happening

The suspensions are failing to reinitialize themselves properly after a decoupling. If you decouple and then either save/reload or switch focus away and then back to the rover, the bouncing should stop. It's being worked on for the next patch release.
Thanks! I did at least get it to be tolerable by turning the spring all the way down.
